title: Improve beadloom annotation coverage to 80%+
description:
## Problem

Current annotation coverage is 4.4% (4 annotations across 90 functions/classes in 14 modules). Only 4 modules out of 14 have any `# beadloom:` annotations, and those are module-level only. Agents using `beadloom ctx` get useful context for only 3 out of 6+ domains.

## Scope

### 1. Add missing graph nodes to services.yml
- `llm-updater` (domain) — LLM integration for auto-updates
- `reindex` (domain) — Full reindex pipeline
- `onboarding` (domain) — Project bootstrap and setup
- `db` (domain) — Database layer (SQLite WAL)
- `doctor` (domain) — Health checks and diagnostics

### 2. Add annotations to all 14 source modules

**High priority (core):**
- `cli.py` (15 symbols) → bind to `cli` node
- `reindex.py` (7 symbols) → bind to `reindex` node
- `llm_updater.py` (9 symbols) → bind to `llm-updater` node

**Medium priority (infrastructure):**
- `onboarding.py` (6 symbols) → bind to `onboarding` node
- `graph_loader.py` (4 symbols) → bind to `graph-format` node
- `doc_indexer.py` (4 symbols) → bind to `doc-sync` node

**Low priority (utilities):**
- `db.py` (4 symbols) → bind to `db` node
- `doctor.py` (7 symbols) → bind to `doctor` node
- `cache.py` (2 symbols) → bind to `context-oracle` node

### 3. Enrich existing annotations
- Go from module-level only to function/class-level for key symbols
- Add cross-domain annotations where functions touch multiple domains

## Acceptance criteria
- [ ] All 14 .py modules have at least one annotation
- [ ] 70%+ of public functions/classes are annotated
- [ ] Graph has nodes for all major domains
- [ ] `beadloom ctx <any-node>` returns relevant code for every node
- [ ] All tests pass, mypy clean
